sensehubr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Global analysis for sensory data

Source: R/analyse-global.R
analyse-global_qda.Rd

Perform global analysis on sensory table.

# S3 method for tbl_sensory_qda
analyse_global(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a sensory table
...

not yet implemented

Value

a sensory table of global analysis

Examples

data(perfume_qda_consumers)
(df <- specify(.data = perfume_qda_consumers,
  panelist = consumer,
  product = product,
  attribute = intensity:green,
  hedonic = NULL,
  method = "QDA"))
#> # A sensory table: QDA <1236 x 23>
#> # Panelist:        consumer <103 subjects>
#> # Product:         product <12 items>
#> # Attribute:       intensity, freshness, jasmin, ro... <21 lexicons>
#> # Hedonic:         None
#>    consumer product intensity freshness jasmin  rose camomille fresh_lemon
#>    <fct>    <fct>       <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1 171      Angel        77        36.1   30    13.3      15.2        15.2

#> #   anis <dbl>, sweet_fruit <dbl>, honey <dbl>, caramel <dbl>, spicy <dbl>,
#> #   woody <dbl>, leather <dbl>, nutty <dbl>, musk <dbl>, animal <dbl>,
#> #   earthy <dbl>, incense <dbl>, green <dbl>
analyse_global(df)

# Using pipe %>%
data(perfume_qda_experts)
perfume_qda_experts %>%
specify(
  panelist = panelist,
  product = product,
  session = session,
  pres_order = rank,
  attribute = spicy:wrapping,
  method = "QDA"
) %>%
analyse_global()
#> # A sensory table:        QDA 
#> # Type:                   Global analysis 
#> # Method:                 PCA
